intro: Dolichandrone arcuata, commonly known as the warty bignay, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in lowland to montane forests and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties. Dolichandrone arcuata is also known for its distinctive warty texture on the bark and stems.
